headline: Easy Swedish Meatball Sauce
description: This quick and easy Swedish meatball sauce turns frozen meatballs into tonight's main attraction. Serve on top of noodles or rice alongside a green salad for the perfect meal.

video.description: Letâ€™s get saucy with this easy meatball sauce!
video.name: Easy Swedish Meatball Sauce

name: Easy Swedish Meatball Sauce
recipeIngredient: 0.5 teaspoon ground black pepper, or more to taste
0.5 teaspoon dried rosemary, crushed, or more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk together stock, cream, flour, soy sauce, 1/2 teaspoon pepper, and 1/2 teaspoon rosemary in a large saucepan over low heat until smooth.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until thickened, about 10 minutes.

Stir in thawed meatballs, and continue cooking until meatballs are heated through, about 5 more minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of the meatballs should read at least 160 degrees F (71 degrees C).
Taste and adjust seasonings before serving.

review.reviewBody: This is a tasty sauce! I used corn starch instead of flour and I doubled the recipe plus added paprika. It's delicious and I always have extra and we just pour it over some toast for a quick breakfast or snack. My husband loves it. I think this would be delicious as a sausage gravy for biscuits too!

I was looking for a simple recipe to make the Swedish meatball sauce and this was it. Unfortunately, I did not have any HWC on hand, but I managed to make it work with whole milk and added butter. I did not change up any of the other spices, kept them as is. Family said it was a keeper!
Decent swedish cream sauce if you ditch the rosemary. For a busy person i recommend instant mashed potatoes on the side
Quick and easy. Very tasty.
This was delicious and quick. I didnâ€™t have black pepper so I used Cajun seasoning. It had a nice flavor.
It was very quick and easy. Had a very good taste to it

I recommend making a rue with butter and flour then adding the rest of the ingredients. I also added sour cream and some Parmesan cheese. Plus onion powder and garlic powder to taste. It turned out great !!

It's a good start, but I added a lot of spices to get a real Swedish meatball taste: 1/8 TSP Garlic Powder 1/8 TSP Onion Powder 1/8 TSP Ginger Powder 1/8 TSP All Spice 1/8 TSP Nutmeg I also used a bit less soy sauce (it just seems sacrelige), and used some coarse salt and a bit more pepper to taste.
Cut Rosemary in 1/2 and loved it!
I adapted this to be vegetarian (not vegan) and used veg broth. Added a pinch of nutmeg just because. Went very well with my bean/mushroom Swedish meatballs. I'll use this recipe again. Thank you.

Another one I really wanted to like. I bought some frozen Swedish meatballs and decided to try this recipe to go with them. The flavor was good but, omg, it was SO rich with all of that heavy cream and much too thick with the addition of 3 tablespoons of flour. I may try it again with half the cream and flour.
Made exactly as described- delicious
Excellent!!
I would have never ever ever thought that something so simple and fast could be absolutely delicious!!! This will be one of my go-to recipes for sure.
very simple and I love the taste. I make it with rice and put the gravy and meatballs on top! Yum!

We love Swedish Meatballs from Ikea, however they tend to make the tummy hurt. I made these for my kids and my one son came downstairs and said, "What's in this sauce, did you make it from scratch or was it bought?" I said, "Why? You don't like it?" and he said, no, it's actually really awesome! So for that, it will be a regular dish in our house. Easy to make and delicious! I did take the advice of another reviewer and added about a 1/4 cup of sour cream since I had to double the recipe due to the size of my family. Low heat did take a bit longer than I wanted to thicken the recipe, so I used medium-high heat.
Ok but low heat? It took 30min to thicken....

So delicious! I used the IKEA meatballs and it was perfect. I had to make it gluten free so I cooked up some rice instead of noodles and thickened the sauce with a couple tablespoons of corn starch instead of flour. I also used less rosemary and pepper, and added a little nutmeg. It was great!
Less cream, more broth,

I am making this meal now for this evening's supper. Honestly, the simplicity of ingredients and minimal amount of steps ( aka effort ; ) is what drew me to this over the others. Everything came together beautifully and it looks like I spent at least an hour and a half rather than the actual 15 minutes! I sampled the sauce and I think I can give IKEA a run for their money!
I made this for dinner today and it turned out great. Only thing I added was one heaping tablespoon of sour cream. I filed this easy recipe in the make again soon file.
This is only ok for us. The sauce is heavy.
I made it the way it said too, and I added parsley flakes to it, it was very good I liked it ðŸ˜€
Easy and turned out delicious. I used half and half. The hubs loves it and said its as good as Moms was. MIL was Swedish.
It turned out good I added a little sour cream and taste better.
Delicious! The only thing I changed was I used light cream instead of heavy cream and it took longer to thicken.
Just salt and pepper to taste
Loved it! Had to use milk with some melted butter because I didnâ€™t have heavy cream and I added some parsley. A keeper!
It's a Good sauce but was a little bit bland.I had to add some garlic and onion to flavor it up a bit.

It's kinda thin but extremely tasty! I used a teaspoon on tones rosemary garlic shaker spice cuz I couldn't find my rosemary but it was super easy and very good will definitely make it qlot in the future

This was very easy and tasty, but I wish I hadn't used the full amount of pepper. Will make again with half the pepper. I used chicken broth and half-and-half, and I didn't defrost the meatballs first.

I made this as written. NO taste, so I added the dollop of sour cream, the splash of red wine, I forget what else. We ate it- there was nothing inherently bad tasting- there was just no taste at all. Never again.

This is such a super simple and quick weekday meal that is so very tasty. We use ground Rosemary and it makes a huge difference as the sauce is so smooth and creamy. We've made this recipe tons of times and will make it tons more.

I didn't have any beef broth liquid so I used 1 pot of broth concentrate with 2 cups of water, dissolved the broth, followed the rest of the recipe as is, and it was delicious!! So simple and tasty. I did add a little bit more pepper when I tasted it, for preference.
Didnâ€™t have soy sauce so used Worcestershire

I loved this simple version of a Swedish Meatball sauce. I used beef base instead of beef stock as that is what I had on hand. I found it a bit too salty so next time I will try a low sodium stock. Other than that, it cooked up creamy and thick enough to coat the meatballs. My family almost didn't save me any leftovers so they must have liked it!
Not a bad gravy, but the flavor was wrong for Swedish meatballs.
HII,BEING A FOOD LOVER REALLY ATTRACTED ME TOWARD YOUR RECIPE. I^LL SUGGEST YOU TO ADD YOUR RECIPES ON KHAL.COM ,IN FORM OF PHOTO RECIPES THE PEOPLES WILL DEFINIETLY LOVE IT.
Delicious... yes with my touches... recipes are only a guide! Remember that.... it's a guide
Already make this recipe, only I use Worchester sauce instead of Soy Sauce. Fast easy recipe.
Similar to Konigsberger Klopse...

I did Angie's alterations and a few of my own to make it mine. A splash of white wine, sauted mushrooms, subbed Worchester for soy, and used Italian meatballs. A 1/4 cup of sour cream evened it out for a cream sauce. Sprinkled some shaved parm on top when I served it - YUM! Goes very well with Hawaiin King rolls or Pillsbury flaky rolls.

Okay so far as it goes, but it doesn't go nearly far enough: the meatballs should be loaded with sweet minced onion, and the sauce with sliced, sauteed sweet onions. (The soy sauce is a great idea though.)
I used homemade meatballs but the sauce was delicious.
Love it itâ€™s my sonâ€™s favorite I actually make a double batch eat half freeze half
This makes a very small amount of gravy. I recommend doubling the recipe if you like to have gravy on your noodles as well. Aside from that the taste is wonderful.

I hate it when people do this, but Iâ€™m going to do it anyways - I subbed the beef broth with water and a teaspoon of vegetable Better Than Bouillon (I suspect any version would work), and used fresh rosemary because that is what I had. I literally stood at the stove licking the spoon it was so good. Put it over veggie meatballs, and my carnivore son cleared his plate without a single complaint.
Loved this recipe. I swapped the soy sauce for Worcestershire sauce and added a splash of soy sauce after it thickened. Added in my meatballs to cook then poured all of it over my noodles.

Quick and easy. Decent as is, but I punched it up a bit with MODIFICATIONS: I added mushrooms, basil, 1 Tablespoon Worcestershire sauce, 1 chopped sweet onion, sour cream, and cut the black pepper in half. To make it less fattening, you could also use milk instead of heavy cream, then thicken it with some extra flour or corn starch.

Easy and tasty! The perfect reciepe! 
Substituted coconut milk for cream. Wife is lactose intolerant.
Delicious! I was thinking it was a lot of pepper, but it was perfect! Wouldn't reduce at all. Will definitely be making this again soon!

I loved this! I used half and half instead of heavy cream, and I gave it extra time to thicken while I made my egg noodles. I used beef bouillon instead of broth, and I used IKEA meatballs. I doubled the recipe and made the whole bag. What a treat!
This is a family favorite! I make it at least once a month. I often double the recipe so I can use the entire bag of meatballs and noodles. Highly recommend!!

It was satisfying and delicious! I adjusted the recipe for 1 (one) serving and altered it as such: used water instead of beef stock; used worsterschire sauce instead of soy sauce; used butter, milk and cream cheese instead of heavy cream; used fresh parsley instead of dried rosemary and added it near the end of cooking. The sauce cooked down much quicker than the instructions say, which is due to the reduced amount of used ingredients. So, when the sauce is well incorporated, I suggest adding the frozen meatballs to sauce sooner and letting the sauce thicken while the meatballs cook through. Absolutely tasty!

Had wonderful flavor. I added 2 tablespoons butter and 1/2cup mushrooms. Baked meatballs which I added on top of buttery mashed potatoes and egg noodles. Then poured sauce over top. It was fabulous! Would recommend doubling recipe for large family.
I liked it I would make it again of course I would triple the recipe so I could have enough to last.

Excellent sauce! I left out the Rosemary and cut the pepper in half. The pepper was still a little much. Iâ€™ll cut that in half next time. Mushrooms would be a great addition that Iâ€™m gonna try next time!
great and easy!
i doubled it cause i have 3 men to feed so i did 20 package thinking that is all i have but i have a 48 oz package so i should have tripled it but they are good thank you

I love making this dish even though I made some adjustments. Soy sauce is salty so I used Worcestershire instead .. cream, flour , butter , beef broth , & added the frozen beef meatballs.. I pair them with any pasta really .. I usually keep like 4 different kinds and donâ€™t have eggs noodles today. I have this Italian seasoning Blend and fresh pepper . Took no more than 20 mins â€¦ I like mine more on creamy side but you can add more water or broth if youâ€™d like .

Added some sautÃ©ed diced onion and a 4 oz can of mushroom pieces. Held my breath adding all the pepper, but it was super fantastic! Super easy and will be a keeper for us. Thick enough gravy to hold up served over mashed cauliflower too!
I would double the sauce if a big sauce pan. I used Rosina meatballs and other than too little sauce. My kids and I thoroughly went yum

I've never had other Swedish meatballs, but this is apparently creamier than most. That being said, it's delicious! The only change is that I usually use frozen meatballs so I heat them in the sauce for about 20 minutes instead of just 5. This is a perfect amount of time to boil some water and cook egg noodles. Great recipe, I make it all the time!
I added Worcester sauce and Montreal seasoning. Over egg noodles it was savory. I will make again.
Love this recipe! Simply and yummy. I did double the recipe and added a splash of Basil Haden....YUMMY!

I made this by the recipe except for adding an entire 18 oz. package of Homestyle Bite Size Meatballs All Natural to the sauce (app 36 count). I also used only half the pepper because I was feeding grandkids, but next time I will add all of it. This made a delicious, quick meal.

The recipe was delicious! I was looking for a recipe that tasted like my favorite meatballs, and this hit the spot. I substituted the beef stock for chicken broth, soy sauce for worstishire sauce, and rosemary for thyme because I didnâ€™t have any of it. This created a delicious meal. I would recommend this to anyone. Definitely a keeper
LOVED this sauce! I added a bit more pepper than what's called for in the recipe. Will definitely be making this again - it was amazing!
This was really easy and tasty. I sautÃ©ed a bunch of baby bella mushrooms and added that to the recipe. Very good.
Made the sauce as directed. Delicious. Easy to follow and quick to make. Definitely adding to my repertoire.
Very flavorful and simple to make. I will add it to my frequently used recipes

Made exactly as written. My picky eaters loved it! It took more than 20 minutes for the sauce to thicken. My meatballs were precooked and heated in the oven before adding it to the sauce. For those questioning 1 tsp of pepper, I started off with 1/2 but ended up using the full tsp. For those questioning the beef broth, why not? Will add this to my rotation. Thank you!

Super easy and tasty. I added only 1/4 tsp of rosemary since I am not a huge fan and I always eyeball the pepper so I am sure I didnâ€™t add a full tsp. Everything else was the same. It was so easy and 4 out of liked it I am sure to make it again.
Good quick recipe for sauce when you have frozen meatballs on hand. I added salt and a teaspoon on nutmeg to the sauce. Was so good.

this has been a hit.. made it at home and was loved by the family. since then have made it for a couple get-together parties.. always have people ask for the recipe, best food at the party. at first looking at the ingredients I had my doubts but not anymore
So delicious and so easy to make and now a staple in our house. Itâ€™s even better the next day reheated.
Family of 5 loved this. Would double recipe next time. Used 2 percent milk and worked just fine.
We eat this almost weekly! We have two adults and two kids (daughters, 7 and 10) and we double everything - except the pepper and noodles - to make sure there is enough for seconds.
Made this as directed except I did not use low temp, it was taking easy too long! increased the heat to medium high and stirred - still came out great! I enjoy simple tasty recipes like this one!
A bit too creamy for me but I loved it. Next time Iâ€™ll use whole milk instead of heavy cream.
Loved this recipe!! Definitely making again

This Recipe was awesome. It happens to be my son's favorite now The only thing that we changed was we didn't add Rosemary and we didn't put as much pepper in. The second time we made it, we fully cooked the meatballs Instead of having them just thawed and then we added it to the sauce and cooked on low for 5 minutes and they turned out perfect. We will definitely be making this again!

Very delicious recipe, however, I disagree with the cooking instructions.

Heat your sauce on medium until a low boil, then add your (thawed) meatballs and cover, stirring regularly for around 15 minutes.
To be honest this recipe is so bad. My boyfriend had to make so many changes to make it edible & the sauce didn't thicken like it should have for the base recipe
Iâ€™ve never purchased frozen meatballs before. So I decided why not? It was easy and a hit with my family. Next time Iâ€™ll make more sauce.
Very easy to make and taste is very good!! We use this recipe when we make it! Yummy!
Love this!! So easy and excellent. I double the recipe and add a little Bavarian seasoning and nutmeg for the authentic taste of Swedish meatballs!
This recipe is really easy and super tasty. Family favorite!
Nice, simple creamy sauce. The next time I make it I'm going to put some brown mustard in it to give it a hint of tanginess.
This is the best Swedish meatball sauce I have ever had!
Loved it. Very delicious
Sauce was a little bland and thick, but great starter. But super easy and will make again!
I made this just as directed. It was amazing. I had to share on Facebook. My husband and daughter really enjoyed it also. Defenitely make again.
I haven't had this meal in many years, I don't remember if it was as spicy! I will probably just use a little less pepper next time!
Super easy. Bland (expected as no spice) so I added Spiced paprika. Added little heat which was needed.
Super easy and oh so tastey!!

Surprisingly fantastic!! I did add a tablespoon of Dijon mustard before simmering. . Then 1/2 cup of sour cream right before serving. Have done with large egg noodles and with white rice, usually broccoli with cheddar or peas served with it!
This is the first time I've used rosemary in a Swedish meatball recipe and it wasn't bad. I might try this without the rosemary and see if it makes it to five stars.
It was good! I up the sevings to 6 and used a 10 oz bag of frozen swedish style meatballs. There was more than enough.
